entry.title: DFDL WG - document #314: Make it easier to assert that an element value is in a set or range
entry.content:
• Status changed from submitted to accepted

a) Testing a value is in a set:

Add XPath 2.0 'intersect' and "except" operators to the list of supported operators.
MultiplicativeExpr ::= IntersectExceptExpr ( ("*" | "div" | "idiv" | "mod") IntersectExceptExpr )*
IntersectExceptExpr ::= UnaryExpr ( ("intersect" | "except") UnaryExpr )*

b) Testing a value is in a range:

Add two DFDL functions:
dfdl:checkRangeInclusive($node, $val1, $val2)
dfdl:checkRangeExclusive($node, $val1, $val2)
Returns boolean true if the specified node value is in the range given by $val1 and $val2.
The type of $val1 and $val2 must be compatible with the type of $node, and must be a derivative of xs:decimal, xs:float or xs:double. It is a schema definition error if the $node argument is a complex element.
